item.title: Katherine add a quote by Murakami
item.description: "I felt it in the morning. I woke up and there was this sheep inside. A perfectly natural feeling. " -- Murakami

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Katherine add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Katherine add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "I solemnly swear that I am up to no good." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Everything you can imagine is real." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Katherine add a quote by E.B. White
Katherine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I tell you, we are here on Earth to fart around, and don't let anybody tell you different." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Katherine add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I felt after I finished Slaughterhouse-Five that I didn’t have to write at all anymore if I didn’t want to. It was the end of some sort of career. I don’t know why, exactly. I suppose that flowers, when they’re through blooming, have some sort of awareness of some purpose having been served. Flowers didn’t ask to be flowers and I didn’t ask to be me. At the end of Slaughterhouse-Five…I had a shutting-off feeling…that I had done what I was supposed to do and everything was OK ." -- Kurt Vonnegut
